FuncDef:
The sr-te-policy threshold-alarm command is used to set the threshold for the number of the SR-MPLS TE policy and the segment list.
The undo sr-te-policy threshold-alarm command is used to restore the default threshold for the number of the SR-MPLS TE policy and the segment list.
By default, the upper limit of the threshold is 80% and the lower limit is 75%.

ParaDef.Info:
Set the upper-limit value (the default value is 75).
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 99, in percentage.

Specifies to set the threshold number of Segment List.
-

Set the upper-limit value (the default value is 80).
The value is an integer that ranges from 2 to 100, in percentage.

Specifies to set the threshold number of SR-MPLS TE Policy.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The command is used to set the threshold for the number of the SR-MPLS TE policy and Segment List. By default, the upper limit of the threshold is 80% and the lower limit is 75%.
